title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones. Tiny changes, remarkable results. No matter your goals, Atomic Habits offers a proven framework for improving every day.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a young girl who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: A reclusive Hollywood icon finally tells her story to a young journalist, revealing her scandalous life, her seven marriages, and the price of fame and love.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A mystery about a young woman who raised herself in the marshes of the deep South, becoming a suspect in a murder case.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set in the distant future amidst a feudal interstellar society, this epic tale follows young Paul Atreides as his family becomes embroiled in a war for control of the desert planet Arrakis.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: Former First Lady Michelle Obama's deeply personal memoir describing her journey from childhood to the White House.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: A lone astronaut must save humanity in this science-packed thriller that combines hard science with an engaging story.

title: The Midnight Library

description: Between life and death there is a library, and within that library, the shelves go on forever. Every book provides a chance to try another life you could have lived.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Set during World War II in Germany, this is the story of Liesel Meminger, a foster girl living outside of Munich, who scratches out a meager existence by stealing books.

title: Circe

description: The story of Circe, the nymph from Homer's Odyssey, who discovers her power of witchcraft and must choose between the gods and mortals.

title: Klara and the Sun
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
description: From the Nobel Prize-winning author comes this beautiful story about an artificial friend's journey to understand the human heart.

title: The Song of Achilles

description: A tale of gods, kings, immortal fame and the human heart, The Song of Achilles is a dazzling literary feat that brilliantly reimagines Homer's enduring masterwork, The Iliad.

title: The Invisible Man
author: Ralph Ellison
description: A landmark novel that chronicles the journey of an African American man's search for identity and meaning in a society that refuses to see him.

title: Normal People

description: A story of mutual fascination, friendship and love following Connell and Marianne from different backgrounds through their years at Trinity College Dublin.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: The classic tale of Elizabeth Bennet and Mr. Darcy, exploring themes of marriage, money, and social class in Regency England.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel about totalitarian control, surveillance, and the individual's struggle against an oppressive state.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: The beloved story of the four March sisters - Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy - growing up during the Civil War.

author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first book in the beloved series about a young wizard discovering his magical heritage and attending Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Set in the Jazz Age on prosperous Long Island, this novel captures the decadence and idealism of the Roaring Twenties through the story of Jay Gatsby.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society where women's rights have been stripped away and fertility is controlled by the state.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence told through the eyes of Scout Finch in Depression-era Alabama.

description: A journalist and a hacker investigate a wealthy family's dark secrets in this gripping Swedish crime thriller.

title: The Kite Runner

description: A powerful story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's tumultuous history.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A psychological thriller about a marriage gone terribly wrong when Amy Dunne disappears on her fifth wedding anniversary.

title: The Fault in Our Stars

title: The Lord of the Rings

description: The epic fantasy adventure following Frodo Baggins and the Fellowship as they journey to destroy the One Ring and defeat the Dark Lord Sauron.

description: A WWII combat nurse is mysteriously swept back in time to 18th-century Scotland, where she meets a Highland warrior.

description: A comic science fiction adventure following Arthur Dent as he travels through space after Earth is destroyed to make way for a hyperspace bypass.

author: Suzanne Collins

description: A dark tale of passion and revenge centered on the tumultuous relationship between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

author: Mary Shelley
description: A young scientist creates a creature through scientific experimentation, exploring themes of creation, responsibility, and what makes us human.

author: Leo Tolstoy
description: An epic novel following the lives of several aristocratic families during the Napoleonic era in Russia.

author: Leo Tolstoy
description: The tragic story of Anna Karenina's affair and its consequences, alongside the contrasting story of Levin's search for meaning.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

title: Kafka on the Shore

description: A surreal story following a teenage boy who runs away from home and an elderly man who can talk to cats.

title: Norwegian Wood
author: Haruki Murakami

title: The Wind-Up Bird Chronicle

author: William Gibson

title: Foundation

description: The first book in Asimov's Foundation series, about psychohistory and the fall and rise of galactic civilizations.

description: A brilliant young boy is recruited to attend a military academy in space to prepare for an alien invasion.

description: An astronaut stranded on Mars must use his scientific knowledge and ingenuity to survive until rescue is possible.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness

description: A human envoy visits a planet where inhabitants can change gender, exploring themes of sexuality, politics, and humanity.

title: The Invisible Man

title: The War of the Worlds

description: Martians invade Earth with superior technology, bringing humanity to the brink of extinction in this classic alien invasion story.

author: H.G. Wells

description: The multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo, blending reality with magical elements.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd's journey to find treasure leads him to discover the importance of following one's dreams.

description: A groundbreaking cyberpunk novel about a washed-up computer hacker hired for one last job in cyberspace.

title: Ulysses

description: A single day in Dublin follows Leopold Bloom and Stephen Dedalus in this modernist masterpiece.

title: A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man
author: James Joyce
description: Stephen Dedalus's development from childhood through young adulthood in Ireland.

title: Finnegans Wake
author: James Joyce
description: Joyce's final and most experimental work, written in a unique linguistic style.

title: Mrs. Dalloway
author: Virginia Woolf
description: A single day in the life of Clarissa Dalloway as she prepares for a party.

title: To the Lighthouse
author: Virginia Woolf
description: The Ramsay family's visits to their summer home on the Isle of Skye.

title: Orlando
author: Virginia Woolf
description: Orlando lives for centuries, changing from man to woman and experiencing different eras.

title: A Room of One's Own
author: Virginia Woolf
description: Woolf's famous essay on women and fiction, arguing for women's intellectual freedom.

title: The Waves
author: Virginia Woolf
description: Six characters' inner lives from childhood to old age, told through internal monologues.

title: The Sound and the Fury
author: William Faulkner
description: The decline of the Compson family told through multiple perspectives and time periods.

title: As I Lay Dying
author: William Faulkner
description: The Bundren family's journey to bury their matriarch, told from multiple viewpoints.

title: Absalom, Absalom!
author: William Faulkner
description: The rise and fall of Thomas Sutpen and his dynasty in the antebellum South.

title: Light in August
author: William Faulkner
description: The story of Joe Christmas and his struggle with racial identity in the South.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A former slave is haunted by the spirit of her dead daughter in post-Civil War Ohio.

title: Song of Solomon
author: Toni Morrison
description: Milkman Dead's journey to discover his family history and cultural identity.

title: The Bluest Eye
author: Toni Morrison
description: A young Black girl wishes for blue eyes and white beauty standards in 1940s Ohio.

title: Sula
author: Toni Morrison
description: The complex friendship between Nel and Sula in a small Ohio town.

title: Jazz
author: Toni Morrison
description: A love triangle in 1920s Harlem told with the rhythm and improvisation of jazz music.

title: Paradise
author: Toni Morrison
description: The story of an all-Black town in Oklahoma and its conflict with a nearby women's shelter.

title: Things Fall Apart
author: Chinua Achebe
description: Okonkwo's life in pre-colonial Nigeria and the impact of European colonization.

title: No Longer at Ease
author: Chinua Achebe
description: Obi Okonkwo struggles between traditional values and modern life in colonial Nigeria.

title: Arrow of God
author: Chinua Achebe
description: A chief priest's struggle to maintain traditional religion against colonial Christianity.

title: Half of a Yellow Sun
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
description: The Nigerian Civil War through the eyes of characters caught in the conflict.

title: Americanah
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
description: A young Nigerian woman's experiences with race and identity in America and upon returning home.

title: Purple Hibiscus
author: Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie
description: A teenager discovers her voice in a religiously strict household in Nigeria.

title: The God of Small Things
author: Arundhati Roy
description: Twins Rahel and Estha return to their childhood home in Kerala, India, haunted by tragedy.

title: Midnight's Children
author: Salman Rushdie
description: Saleem Sinai's life parallels the history of India from independence to the Emergency.

title: The Satanic Verses
author: Salman Rushdie
description: Two actors fall from a hijacked plane and undergo strange transformations.

title: The Moor's Last Sigh
author: Salman Rushdie
description: The chronicle of the Moor's family spanning four generations in Bombay.

title: The White Tiger
author: Aravind Adiga
description: Balram Halwai's rise from village poverty to entrepreneurial success in modern India.

author: Rohinton Mistry
description: Four people from different backgrounds come together during India's Emergency period.

title: Shantaram

description: An escaped convict finds refuge in the slums of Bombay and becomes involved with the mafia.

title: The Mahabharata

description: A retelling of the great Indian epic about duty, righteousness, and the Kurukshetra War.

title: The Ramayana

description: The story of Prince Rama's quest to rescue his wife Sita from the demon king Ravana.

title: The Guide
author: R.K. Narayan
description: Raju transforms from a corrupt tour guide to a spiritual leader in a small Indian town.

title: The English Teacher
author: R.K. Narayan
description: A teacher's journey through grief after his wife's death and his spiritual awakening.

title: The Vendor of Sweets
author: R.K. Narayan
description: A traditional sweet vendor struggles to understand his Westernized son.

title: Train to Pakistan

description: The story of Partition told through a small Punjabi village on the border.

title: Nectar in a Sieve
author: Kamala Markandaya

title: The Inheritance of Loss

description: Stories of migration and belonging set between India and New York.

title: The Namesake

title: Interpreter of Maladies

title: Unaccustomed Earth
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

title: The Lowland
author: Jhumpa Lahiri

title: Kim
author: Rudyard Kipling
description: An Irish orphan boy grows up on the streets of colonial India and becomes a spy.

title: The Jungle Book
author: Rudyard Kipling
description: Stories of Mowgli, a boy raised by wolves in the Indian jungle.

title: A Passage to India
author: E.M. Forster
description: Cultural misunderstandings and racial tensions in British-ruled India.

title: Howards End

description: The connection between the Schlegel and Wilcox families and the house that binds them.

title: A Room with a View
author: E.M. Forster
description: Lucy Honeychurch's romantic awakening during a trip to Italy.

title: Maurice
author: E.M. Forster
description: A young man's discovery of his homosexuality in Edwardian England.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: Seven generations of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: Love in the Time of Cholera
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: Florentino Ariza's fifty-year quest to win the love of Fermina Daza.

title: Chronicle of a Death Foretold
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The investigation of a murder that the entire town knew was going to happen.

title: The Autumn of the Patriarch
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The life and death of a Caribbean dictator seen through the eyes of his people.

title: The House of the Spirits
author: Isabel Allende
description: Four generations of the del Valle and Trueba families in an unnamed Latin American country.

title: Eva Luna
author: Isabel Allende
description: The life story of Eva Luna, a storyteller in a turbulent Latin American country.

title: Like Water for Chocolate
author: Laura Esquivel
description: Tita's emotions affect her cooking in this magical tale of love and family recipes.

title: Pedro Páramo
author: Juan Rulfo
description: Juan Preciado travels to find his father in a town populated by ghosts.

title: Hopscotch
author: Julio Cortázar
description: An experimental novel that can be read in multiple orders.

title: Blow-Up and Other Stories
author: Julio Cortázar
description: Surreal and innovative short stories exploring reality and perception.

title: Ficciones
author: Jorge Luis Borges
description: Borges' most famous collection of short stories exploring labyrinths, mirrors, and infinity.

title: Labyrinths
author: Jorge Luis Borges
description: Selected stories and essays by the master of philosophical fiction.

title: The Aleph
author: Jorge Luis Borges
description: Stories exploring themes of infinity, time, and the nature of reality.

title: The Tunnel
author: Ernesto Sabato
description: Pablo Castel's obsessive account of why he murdered the only woman who understood his art.

description: The monologue of Paraguay's 19th-century dictator Dr. Francia.

title: The Joke
author: Milan Kundera

author: Milan Kundera

description: German soldiers' experiences during World War I from the trenches.

description: Hans Castorp's extended stay at a Swiss sanatorium becomes a philosophical journey.

description: Werther's obsessive love for Charlotte leads to tragic consequences.

description: Dr. Faust makes a pact with the devil in exchange for knowledge and power.

author: Franz Kafka
